job_title: Head of Department in Hemel Hempstead, England
pros: Hightown is financially solid, and very well managed in that respect. We seem to be able to weather any economic storm, from Covid, to Brexit, and beyond. Nothing seems to stop us. For that reason it's a great place to be employed at the moment!
cons:
Besides the feelgood factor of working for Hightown, the employee benefits are pretty thin and could be much better.

All Head Office staff have been able to work remotely since March 2020 due to Covid, but the powers that be won't make any decision on a permanent arrangement for flexible remote working until everyone is back in the office, whenever that might be. This leaves many of us shaking our heads, and this indecision WILL cost us some of our best employees, of that I am positive.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Hemel Hempstead, England
pros:
Hightown is a rapidly growing housing association with a great reputation amongst peers and the local area.  The facilities at the Head Office are modern with a gym and there's a good atmosphere of people wanting to work together.  

Hightown puts on an annual staff conference where everyone gets together and gets to give something back to the local community. 

It is expected that staff work hard and have a can do attitude and this is at all levels of the organisation.  Overall this creates a good team spirit to do good for the community and those individuals who we support.

There are lots of career opportunities for the care side of the business and there are a number of committed individuals who have progressed through the organisation
cons: If you want to work for Hightown you need to believe the values and work hard to support those.  It's not an organisation for individuals who are looking to sit back and take it easy.  The benefits are statutory but the pay is good and compensates for this to ensure everyone is treated fairly no matter what their circumstances.
